decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly assembling a powerful combo using cards that manipulate the stack and generate mana without relying on traditional lands. By utilizing powerful creatures like Fallaji Archaeologist and Tameshi, Reality Architect, along with spells like Disrupting Shoal and Flare of Denial, the deck aims to generate enough mana to cast Goblin Charbelcher and deal massive damage to the opponent. Additionally, cards like Beyeen Veil and Jwari Disruption provide disruption and protection, while Whir of Invention can help find key pieces to execute the combo efficiently.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells and mana acceleration to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures, such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also includes control elements like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its large creatures and powerful spells, while also having some utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Cavern of Souls for added versatility. Its unique blend of ramp and control elements make it a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using creatures with strong abilities and combat prowess. The deck includes powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional reach and value. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Arena of Glory and Elegant Parlor to support the aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with an emphasis on tempo and card advantage. It aims to quickly deploy threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Slickshot Show-Off, and Monastery Swiftspear while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration helps in maintaining card advantage, while cards like Violent Urge and Mutagenic Growth provide additional reach and protection for our creatures. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to both red and blue spells.

This combo deck focuses on using cards like Indomitable Creativity and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Valgavoth, Terror Eater. The deck also utilizes a mix of control elements like Leyline Binding and removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of unique cards like Wrenn and Six and Teferi, Time Raveler adds versatility and flexibility to the deck's strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements while maximizing consistency and efficiency.

The deck focuses on using a combination of card draw, counterspells, and removal spells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Teferi, along with versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Murktide Regent, to establish board presence and control the flow of the game. The deck also includes a mix of efficient removal spells and versatile counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. With a focus on card advantage and efficient interaction, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent in the long game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively and quickly, utilizing a mix of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Solitude to control the board and disrupt opponent's strategies. Additionally, the inclusion of Leyline Binding and Relic of Progenitus enables graveyard hate and disruption. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's diverse mana requirements while maintaining consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early pressure and efficient threats.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and utilizing powerful multicolor spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to establish board presence early with efficient creatures like Scion of Draco and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while using cards like Tribal Flames and Leyline Binding to deal direct damage and control the opponent's board. The deck's versatility and speed come from its multicolor mana base, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and maintaining pressure on the opponent. Ultimately, the goal is to maintain a fast-paced aggressive strategy to outpace and defeat the opponent.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. The key strategy involves using Amulet of Vigor to untap lands multiple times, allowing for explosively fast plays and enabling the use of lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field for additional value. The deck also includes powerful lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle for additional reach and closing out games quickly. Overall, this combo-amulet Titan deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large threats and efficient mana generation.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing creatures with abilities that can deal damage quickly, supported by spells that provide additional damage or protection. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures, spells, and lands that synergize well together to maintain a steady stream of damage output. The addition of cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Goblin Bombardment allows for additional ways to deal damage and control the board. The deck also includes ways to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm.

The deck focuses on using ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements such as All Is Dust and Malevolent Rumble to clear the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and flexibility, while cards like Ancient Stirrings help to find key pieces of the deck. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with large, game-ending creatures while controlling the board and disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and ramping up mana to quickly cast powerful spells to control the game. Utilizing cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and All Is Dust to clear the board, while also using cards like Kozilek's Return and Kozilek's Command for removal. The deck also includes win conditions like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths to close out the game. The mana ramp provided by Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple allows for quick deployment of threats, making it difficult for opponents to keep up.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling combos that allow you to reanimate powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, Griselbrand, and Emperor of Bones using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. It also includes disruptive spells like Fatal Push, Force of Negation, and Thoughtseize to control the game and protect your combo pieces. The land base is carefully crafted to support the demanding mana requirements of the deck while including utility lands like Hedge Maze and Undercity Sewers. Overall, the deck aims to quickly bring out powerful threats and disrupt your opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently deal damage to your opponent using cheap spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, and Slickshot Show-Off alongside burn spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt, you can apply pressure early in the game and finish off your opponent with a flurry of spells. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Expressive Iteration and Preordain to help maintain aggression and consistency throughout the game.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up with creatures like Scion of Draco and Wild Nacatl to overwhelm the opponent with powerful attacks. It also utilizes Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to control the board and protect its creatures. Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames provide additional damage to finish off opponents. The deck includes a mix of creatures, spells, and lands to create a fast and aggressive strategy that aims to win the game before the opponent can set up their own game plan.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly generate mana and card advantage by utilizing artifacts, such as Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Portable Hole and Metallic Rebuke. Emry, Lurker of the Loch is a key card in this strategy, allowing players to constantly recur artifacts from the graveyard. Urza's Saga serves as a powerful enchantment that can search for key artifacts in the deck, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card selection and synergizes well with the artifact theme.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly to play powerful land cards like Urza's Saga and Primeval Titan, while also utilizing combo pieces like Amulet of Vigor and Scapeshift to generate overwhelming board presence and finish the game quickly. With a mix of land tutoring cards and powerful land synergy, the deck aims to efficiently assemble its key pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful land-based strategy. Considering the deck's composition, the key strategy revolves around utilizing land-based combos and synergies to quickly establish a dominating board presence and close out the game in a swift manner.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to get out powerful creatures like Primeval Titan. It also utilizes lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field to generate additional value. The deck aims to assemble the Amulet Titan combo as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and land-based synergies while utilizing cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key pieces. The goal is to create a dominant board presence and win the game through efficient combo plays.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick creature drops and damage dealing spells to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, as well as burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls provide additional support and creature buffs, while cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison help to disrupt the opponent's game plan. This deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive creature attacks and burn spells.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by using low cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes some control elements like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck is heavily centered around the Boros colors, utilizing red for burn and white for creature buffs and removal. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to both colors. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast creatures and direct damage spells.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy, utilizing a mix of creatures and burn spells to deal damage efficiently. The deck includes high-powered creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride for added aggression. To control the board, Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison can help remove threats, while cards like Thraben Charm provide utility. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and deal damage efficiently to secure a win.

The deck revolves around using a variety of creatures to generate value and create combos. Cauldron Familiar and Gilded Goose provide consistent value, while Samwise Gamgee and Carrion Feeder can be used to sacrifice creatures for additional benefits. The toolbox of creatures allows for flexibility in different situations, with the ability to tutor for specific creatures using Chord of Calling. The deck also includes cards like Birthing Ritual and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to generate additional advantage. Overall, the deck aims to generate incremental advantage and create powerful combos to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the opponent's board while applying pressure. By using cards like Fatal Push, Prismatic Ending, and Thoughtseize to remove threats, and cards like Aether Vial and Ephemerate to cheat creatures onto the battlefield, the deck aims to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Witch Enchanter, the deck can quickly close out games while keeping the opponent on the back foot.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. Utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Force of Negation, and Spell Snare to deal with threats on the board while also using cards like Abhorrent Oculus and Psychic Frog to provide blockers and card advantage. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card selection and card advantage, while Murktide Regent can provide a clock to close out the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them in the long run.

This deck aims to utilize the cascade mechanic to quickly cycle through cards and eventually cast Living End, which will bring back all creatures from both players' graveyards to the battlefield. By controlling the board with disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Sink into Stupor, the deck can stall until it can combo off and overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures. The deck also features powerful threats like Curator of Mysteries and Endurance to pressure the opponent and provide additional win conditions.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through ritual effects and cantrips to cast multiple spells in a single turn. The key strategy is to loop through spells using Ral, Monsoon Mage's -2 ability and Past in Flames to eventually win with a large Grapeshot or Artist's Talent. The deck also utilizes Valakut Awakening to refill the hand and Wrenn's Resolve to protect the combo pieces. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to provide consistent access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck.

The focus of this deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing a combination of cheap spells and creatures to deal damage quickly and efficiently. With a mix of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure victory before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge further enhance the deck's aggressiveness, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Preordain help ensure consistent draws and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and deal damage quickly using a combination of direct damage spells, efficient creatures, and card draw. By casting cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth while consistently applying pressure with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration helps to maintain card advantage and ensure that the deck can maintain its aggressive tempo.

The main concept of this deck is to deal damage quickly and efficiently through a combination of aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells such as Preordain and Expressive Iteration to maintain card advantage and consistency. The mana base is optimized for quick access to the necessary colors and lands. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, aggressive strategy in order to quickly reduce their life total to zero.

This deck focuses on creating a strong board presence by utilizing Urza as the centerpiece of a control strategy. By using artifacts like Thopter Foundry, Mishra's Bauble, and Mox Opal in combination with cards like Emry and Tamiyo, the deck aims to generate value through card advantage and resource manipulation. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and powerful artifact cards allows the deck to quickly establish a dominant position on the battlefield, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Portable Hole and Malevolent Rumble.
